poem:
Title: Empty Gold

In the jagged play of twisted youth,
rife with the pealing echoes of old laughter,
the sly, sharp-toothed beast lies unfettered-
smothered not by the rosy veil of innocence.
His rough hand claims tomorrow's bounty,
a fatted calf of prosperity, ripe for the taking.
Yet as dawn breaks the back of night,
the emptiness of his victory opens,
a silent wound.
